channel.title: Fur Trade Days
channel.description: Recent content on Fur Trade Days

item.title: Carnival
item.description: We are excited to partner with Mac’s to bring you another outstanding Fur Trade Days Carnival in 2023! With 14 great rides, concessions, and the midway, Mac’s Carnival has something fun for kids of all ages.

item.title: Entertainment!
item.description: Fur Trade Days is excited to bring you great entertainment downtown. This year features bands out of the Black Hills, Flannel on Friday and Judd Hoos Saturday nights!

item.title: Traders' Market
item.description: From food to finds, antiques and oddities, the Fur Trade Days Traders' Market features food vendors and craft merchants from around the region and across the country; providing something of interest for just about everyone.

item.title: Lions Club FTD Parade
item.description: The 47th Annual Lions Club Fur Trade Days Parade starts at 10 a.m. on Saturday, July 15 and proceeds down Main Street from Tenth to First streets. Candy and other goodies will be passed out along the parade route. Come early to claim a good seat and enjoy the excitement!

item.title: Activities and More
item.description: Family-friendly fun begins Friday at the Dawes County Court House Gazebo.

item.title: Buckskinner's Camp
item.description: The Bordeaux Creek Fur Trade and Muzzleloading Association’s Rendezvous, located 3.5 miles east and 8 miles south of Chadron, is expected to open Thursday, July 13, for camp setup.

item.title: Forms
item.description: Entry forms, event signups, and posters will appear here.

item.title: Reunions
item.description: CHS Class of 2003, 20 year Reunion Friday, July 14, Class Picnic, Wilson Park Shelter (8th Street & Chadron Avenue) 5-9 p.m. Saturday, July 15, Fur Trade Parade, Meet along 10th Street, 9:30 a.m. For more specifics or to RSVP, check out the Class of 2003 Facebook Group or get in touch with Danielle Lecher at (308)430-0939 or danielle_lecher@hotmail.com ​To list your reunion information, email info@furtradedays.com.

item.title: Schedule
item.description: 2023 Fur Trade Days events last updated April 25, 2023 — Event times are tentative and subject to change Thursday, July 13, 2023 All Day - Buckskinners primitive camp, open to visitors (3 Miles East, ~8 miles south from Museum of the Fur Trade) 6-9 p.m. - Bands on Bordeaux - TBD (First Street, between Main & Bordeaux streets) 6 p.m. - Midnight - Mac’s Carnival (East Second & Bordeaux streets)

item.title: Museum of The Fur Trade
item.description: The Museum of the Fur Trade is located on the James Bordeaux trading post, which has become an important historical site over the years. The trading post was established in the fall of 1837 as a site for the American Fur Company to conduct business with American Indians who spent their winters in the area. Traders, Trappers, and Indians The Museum of the Fur Trade is dedicated to preserving the rich history of the North American fur trade.

item.title: Our History
item.description: Northwest Nebraska The Community of Chadron and all of Northwest Nebraska welcomes you to the unforgettably unique celebration of Fur Trade Days. Chadron, located in the northwest corner of Nebraska, was named for the French fur trader Louis Baptiste Chartran. This event offers a weekend filled with history, rendezvous, entertainment, down-home hospitality, great food, and lots of fun! There is something for everyone and a chance to see neighbors and make new friends.

item.title: Our Sposors
item.description: 2019 Entertainment Sponsors White Buffalo Presenting Sponsor
